title: FP91G
author: FP91G
content: NVIDIA RTX 3080 vapor chamber with a hole develops blue substance insideAs per the QuasarZone report, certain RTX 3080 Founders Edition and RTX A6000 graphics cards may be susceptible to problems related to vapor chamber cracking. The initial thread on this issue was initiated by a member, likely a technician, who was assigned the task of investigating the root cause behind the excessively high hot spot temperatures exhibited by these cards.Importantly, these graphics cards had not been previously opened or subjected to repasting, as confirmed by the original author of the thread. However, it was swiftly determined that there was a breach in the vapor chamber. This breach resulted from a chemical reaction that gradually created a hole within the vapor chamber. Because of this, fluid leaked out of the chamber and oxygen got into the void.https://videocardz.com/newz/breaking-badly-when-blue-substance-is-found-in-cracked-geforce-rtx-3080-vapor-chamber

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: The NVIDIA RTX 3080 graphics card should be discontinued soon so as not to compete with the new RTX 4000 series. I have seen defects with cooling systems in many cards, such as the GTX 1060. The danger lies with buyers of this video card on the secondary market.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I hadn’t heard this one but developing a blue substance inside sounds like a problem that you probably don’t want to have when it comes to an expensive electrical device with a very high operating temperature. Sounds more like an episode of Breaking Bad than a report on graphics card issues. Hope they got this issue figured out.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: The RTX 3080 video card on the secondary market is no longer very expensive. The new one will have a 3 year warranty and I did not see such problems in the first 3 years. I even blew up heat pipes above the video chip, but that was after 3 years of mining.So buyers of used video cards bear all the risks.
